note.p: Death: His home, Shepherd's Down, Haslemere, Surrey (10 November 1924)
Education: High School, Edinburgh; University of Edinburgh

Career: Entered the Geological Survey (1855); Murchison Professor of Geology and Mineralogy, University of Edinburgh (1871-1882); Director, Geological Survey of the United Kingdom; Director, Museum of Practical Geology (1882-1901)
Memberships: FRSE; FGS; Foreign Associate, Institute of France
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1926 vol 111 pp xxiv-xxvii, plate, signed by J R B, and pp xxvii-xxxix signed by J H
Proc Roy Soc Series B 1926 vol 99 pp i-iv, plate, signed by J R B,and pp iv-xvi signed by J H
References: Beryl M Hamilton, '"A Geological Blunder", 1893: A Scientific Storm in a Journalistic Teacup' in NR 1991 vol 45 pp 63-77
A C S, 'Notes on the Foundation and History of the Royal Society' in NR 1938 vol 1 pp 32-36
